sentence.Network_cn: 我在飞机上小睡了一会儿.

entry.def: A snooze is a short, light sleep, especially during the day.
If you snooze, you sleep lightly for a short period of time.

example.ex: Mark snoozed in front of the television...
example.tran: 马克在电视机前打起盹儿来。

example.ex: Patients are given an extra 15 minutes to snooze before being woken gently.
example.tran: 在被轻轻叫醒之前，病人还有 15 分钟的小睡时间。

means.word_mean: 1. a short sleep (usually not in bed)
1. sleep lightly or for a short period of time

auth_sentence.content: Take a luxurious snooze on your king-size bed before heading out for a dip.
auth_sentence.res_content: Take a luxurious snooze on your king-size bed before heading out for a dip.

sentences.en: He was snoozing by the table.
